metadata.name: Use of W32tm as Timer
metadata.comment: When configured with suitable command line arguments, w32tm can act as a delay mechanism

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\w32tm.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('w32time.dll') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/stripchart')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/computer:')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/period:')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/dataonly')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/samples:')))

output.summary: When configured with suitable command line arguments, w32tm can act as a delay mechanism
